chapter.para: This section covers methods that create multi-dimensional visualizations contained in the MultiD module. These methods provide ways to depict data in a multi-dimensional space.

sect1.title: Area

row.entry: Location of the result set (WUID, Logical File, Roxie Query result), defaults to the current WU
Result set name (ignored for Logical Files)
Filter condition (also useful for widget interactions)

sect1.para: The Area visualization method displays graphically quantitative data. The area between the axis and each line is shown and can be emphasized using shading or colors. This is commonly used to compare two or more quantities.

sect1.title: Bar

row.entry: Location of the result set (WUID, Logical File, Roxie Query result), defaults to the current WU
Result set name (ignored for Logical Files)
Filter condition (also useful for widget interactions)

sect1.para: The Bar visualization method displays a graph consisting of horizontal rectangles (bars) where each length is proportional to data value.

sect1.title: Column

row.entry: Location of the result set (WUID, Logical File, Roxie Query result), defaults to the current WU
Result set name (ignored for Logical Files)
Filter condition (also useful for widget interactions)

sect1.para: The Column visualization method displays a graph consisting of vertical rectangles (bars) where each length is proportional to data value.

sect1.title: HexBin

row.entry: Location of the result set (WUID, Logical File, Roxie Query result), defaults to the current WU
Result set name (ignored for Logical Files)
Filter condition (also useful for widget interactions)

sect1.para: The HexBin visualization method displays a Hexagonal Bin plot which plots two or more continuous variables against each other. Hexagonal binning is useful for aggregating data values into a coarser display. For example, rather than showing thousands of points on a scatter plot, you can combine points into a few hexagons to show the distribution.

sect1.title: Line

row.entry: Location of the result set (WUID, Logical File, Roxie Query result), defaults to the current WU
Result set name (ignored for Logical Files)
Filter condition (also useful for widget interactions)

sect1.para: The Line visualization method displays a line graph which uses points connected by lines to show how values change.

sect1.title: Scatter

row.entry: Location of the result set (WUID, Logical File, Roxie Query result), defaults to the current WU
Result set name (ignored for Logical Files)
Filter condition (also useful for widget interactions)

sect1.para: The Scatter visualization method displays a scatter plot using horizontal and vertical axes to plot data points.

sect1.title: Step

row.entry: Location of the result set (WUID, Logical File, Roxie Query result), defaults to the current WU
Result set name (ignored for Logical Files)
Filter condition (also useful for widget interactions)

sect1.para: The Step visualization method creates a step graph made of lines in horizontal intervals or 'steps'.
